subject: RE: [junit] execution log file
msgSnippet: Sorry, For me all it needed was the steps I listed. I ve installed & run the JUnit - Ant integration on some 4-5 machines the last week, and had no problems.
messageBody:
Sorry,
For me all it needed was the steps I listed.
I've installed & run the JUnit - Ant integration on some 4-5 machines the last week, and had no problems.
If your errors would have been in the junitreport task, I'd look for XML parser collisions. That's not your case, so I'm clueless. Try looking for old JUnit jars littered on your disk. Perhaps one of them fell into the Ant classpath (you know it generates it dynamically).

- Yishay


At 04:43 PM 7/4/2001 +0100, you wrote:
I had look back though the archives and I found some junit/ant posts to/from Yishay, but I didn't find any special steps that need to be taken.  I've got my class path set with all the junit and ant jars but it don't work out of the box.
 
Are there any specific customisation steps that anyone can advise?
 
Thanks
 
Dave
-----Original Message-----
From: Sanjay Bhatia [mailto:sbix@...]
Sent: 04 July 2001 16:40
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [junit] execution log file
WOW!  That was really informative.  How about putting in a line or 2 about what
help you received from your friends on the list?  Or are you too accustomed to
just receiving help?

sb
